pages.text: The $(thing)Boiler Conversion$() is an augment that converts a $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/steam_dynamo)Steam Dynamo$(), $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/magmatic_dynamo)Magmatic Dynamo$() or $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/compression_dynamo)Compression Dynamo$() into a steam boiler. This increases overall efficiency.

pages.title: Mechanics
pages.text: A $(thing)Boiler Conversion$() considerably changes the way the dynamo works. Instead of outputting RF, the dynamo outputs steam instead. For each RF that would otherwise be produced, 1 millibucket of steam will be generated instead.$(p)$(thing)Boiler Conversions$() also change the amount of RF produced by the dynamo as well as the maximum power output.

When used in a $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/steam_dynamo)Steam Dynamo$(), maximum power output is increased vourfold and energy output per item ins increased by +15%. In a $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/magmatic_dynamo)Magmatic Dynamo$() or $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/compression_dynamo)Compression Dynamo$(), maximum power output is doubled but a -40% energy penalty is applied.$(p)In a $(thing)Compression Dynamo$(), coolant fuel efficiency bonus also doesn't apply.

When $(thing)steam$() is sent into a $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/steam_dynamo)Steam Dynamo$() with a $(l:mods_thermalexpansion/turbine_conversion)Turbine Conversion$(), 2RF is generated for every millibucket of steam. Also, dynamos with this augment will always output steam at its maximum rate, $(bold)no matter how much is consumed$(). Keep this in mind when designing a power system based on steam.
